intro: Corunastylis cornuta, commonly known as the horned corunastylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral bracts that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
